979166950470205441.text:
we all work to improve the “state” of the world. cure cancer, go to mars, (all versions of “leveling up”)...

but maybe I should strive to improve the “experience” of a tangible group of people.

979163809590927360.text: but this is not for an individual (“single player mode”) but for a group of people to come together in a more nuanced and subtle empathy for our shared set of experiences. bringing us closer together by being able to have a more vivid common ground.

979163052850405376.text: then, articulating what happened in a way to express your own experience (“expressionist”) or to reconstruct the experience for others (“impressionist”) is immensely important to internalizing any event vividly. (cc @gavofyork)

979160665553125376.text:
however, we’re not happier or more secure or more peaceful.

maybe we can achieve that through deeply experiencing the subtleties of the precious and the mundane alike. maybe it comes from being able to share and communicate those depths with others.

979159802310832128.text:
in a viral setting, memes “win.” they propagate more and faster. we live in a viral world today.

look at where our attention goes (fb, twitter, instagram). it even determined the US presidency

simple, high attention grabbing, low-brain (animal instinct) stimulus. dopamine.

979158879626936321.text:
state is simple and discrete. it allows for easy communication, and therefore fit for the fast transmission across social media.

experience is subtle and complex.  often not fully captured by the lowest common denomination of shared vocabulary.

979157873673449472.text:
**perception** wake up, eat, read, look in mirror, go to bed.

**experience** a slow and quiet morning with a loved one, breaking bread with family, getting lost in a good book, looking in the mirror and loving yourself, going to bed feeling safe and loved

979157483703775232.text: experience is the opinionated reality that we each perceive.

979155208751099905.text: while “state”—these collectible markers of success—improves any individual’s “experience”, too often it trends towards obtaining more “state” at the cost of degrading “experience.”

979153948589215744.text:
the news doesn’t read “Space nerd @elonmusk launched a rocket.” It reads “billionaire @elonmusk launched a rocket.”

another child reads the headline and her lens of the world is shaped through our words. and reconfirms the bias in the rest of us. another layer deeper.

979152144438722560.text:
wealth/income, education, group membership, title, looks ... # of likes/followers.

these are the outputs of the “optimization function.” the score card for an opt-out video game that we all play

979151401619095552.text: much of the prevailing worldviews today center around improving “state”. things that can be measured or articulated plainly.

979148893374959616.text:
I’d say the main difference would be: 

more effort to improve experience rather than state.

918182351837863936.text: 15 // Most importantly, technologists: let's create value by building *useful and compelling* decentralized infrastructure and applications

918181995166887936.text: 14 // ... buying a whitepaper at 9-10 figure valuation is like buying a blueprint for a unbuilt, fancy timeshare from a guy on the street

918181694942863361.text: 13 // Investors: know when you're paying too much for too little.

918181215844237312.text: 12 // So, entrepreneurs: money comes with expectations. Balance need for money with the cost of expectations.

918179602412978176.text: 11 // If not, the price appreciation will prove premature and "overshot," which may cause multiple compression (read: price decrease).

918179236652843008.text: 10 // Important. Rapid price appreciation must be matched by equally rapid adoption and value accrual over the lifetime of a network.

918178879419817984.text: 9 // Value accretion means: people transacting crypto, people using decentralized apps and value accruing to the protocol layer.

918178593984802816.text: 8 // And the expectation–the social and financial contract–is multiple compression via value accretion.

918178276715020288.text: 7 // Crypto is very well capitalized, but all money comes with expectations.

918177758554943488.text: 6 // So, we can see multiples expanding much further before compressing. Radically different than valuation of mature companies & economies

918177331792953344.text: 5 // Crypto is nascent, has huge addressable market, and has captured the attention of investors & speculators with unprecedented returns

918176250006454272.text: 4 // In cryptoeconomics, I believe a rough proxy of price/value is **fully-diluted network market capitalization / network activity metric**

918174833879293952.text: 3 // The margin of leeway between margin expansion and compression depends on market perception of the industry and the specific entity.

918174475736170496.text: 2 // If multiple compression is "delivered" via value increase, then more great expectations may re-expand the multiple.

918174092796207104.text: 1 // Price/Value multiple can expand with great expectations. It should compress as you make progress toward that goal.

899357972182257668.text: 29 / thanks for reading super rough and wide-ranging thoughts. welcome feedback! will follow up with more structured thoughts later

899357484359585792.text: 28 / ... unless tokens have a stake in economic value of network, how it allocates new coins will largely determine its economic viability

899356735399481345.text: 27 / ... impact of new information re: future innovation should reflect a proper discount rate ($100 tomorrow is not worth $100 today)

899355879845351424.text: 26 / ... more coins/tokens mined/vested without more network activity should be considered dilutive (and be followed by a decrease in price)

899355610168340480.text: 25 / so in crypto, price increase without more network activity or more value capture should be considered increase in premium ("expensive")

899355437811814400.text: 24 / for fiat, credit worthiness of the issuing entity (among other factors) determines the money supply's effect on economy

899355166893387777.text: 23 / for debt & equity, appreciation and yield (price & interest. price & dividends) naturally balance out the discount rate / multiple

899354783164899328.text: 22 / however, (a) relationship between coin & NV, (b) dilutive design of network, (c) benchmarks for "NV/NA" will matter regardless

899354123161804800.text: 21 / (most of these analogies are obviously dependent on whether given crypto asset/currency is designed to be a security or not)

899353506229964801.text: 20 / higher multiples signal how much of a premium market is willing to pay. but risk profiles normalize across asset classes over long-term

899353157549084674.text: 19 / in real estate, "capitalization rates" signal these concepts (inversely). nyc & sf have low cap rates. detroit has high cap rates.

899352828505972737.text: 18 / for given level of "network activity," networks with "higher margins" (more value transferred to holders) will command higher NV/NA

899352502172348416.text: 17 / "network activity" depends on the particular economy. txn amount, volume. computation. storage. contracts. ebitda/gdp proxy

899351908854452228.text: 16 / network value should be *fully-diluted* market cap + any debt/mezz claims

899351605354430465.text: 15 / more demand, stability, growth increases the multiple and lowers the discount rate. uncertainty, risk, stagnation does the opposite.

899351356305272832.text: 14 / those ratios proxy (a) discount rate / risk (faster growth ~ higher mult) & (b) ability to capture value (higher margin ~ higher mult)

899350833590128642.text: 13 / companies have TEV/Rev, TEV/EBITDA. countries debt/GDP, money supply / GDP. crypto should have Network Value / "Network Activity" ratio

899348997562937344.text: 12 / inflation behaves differently than stock dilution because value isn't evenly distributed (more returns to those with access to capital)

899348543785316352.text: 11 / for countries, issuing more fiat means same number of goods & services are claimed by more fiat, decreasing per unit value (inflation)

899347976832921600.text: 10 / re dilution, if co with 10m shares at $500/sh issues 10m more shares (or stock split), shares are now worth $250/sh with 20m shares.

899346598945320960.text: 9 / however, how it was financed will change the nature of risk. debt ~ default risk. equity ~ dilution risk.

899346103593820161.text: 8 / enterprise value of a  shop with $10k profit should not change whether it was financed by $50k loan or by selling 10% of co for $50k

899344877531664384.text: 7 / modigliani-miller theorem proposed that value of an entity should be unaffected by how it is financed (in absence of frictional costs)

899343362066698240.text: 6 / when trading stocks, we analyze market cap but a better measure for a firm's value is enterprise value (m.c. + ~debt - cash reserves)

899341800963547136.text: 5 / it is an equity analog, because equity is a claim to the net income or dividend of the entity

899341113953267713.text: 4 / although fiat has not been considered an equity analog, it effectively represents a claim on the goods & services of the country

899340773140901888.text: 3 / governments are the same. revenue (via taxes), debt (gov bonds), or equity financing (fiat currency).

899340519200960512.text: 2 / companies can finance themselves through profits, debt or equity financing.
